title: 115_s1830
content: The Act titled "Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2017" aims to enhance cost savings. The Act "Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2017" includes definitions related to surplus salaries and expenses funds in agencies. The Act allows for the identification and rescission of unnecessary funds by agency employees, the Inspector General, or the Chief Financial Officer, as long as it does not hinder the original purpose of the funds. The Act allows for the identification and rescission of unnecessary funds by agency employees, the Inspector General, or the Chief Financial Officer, as long as it does not hinder the original purpose of the funds. The Inspector General or designated agency employee must refer potential surplus salaries and expenses funds to the Chief Financial Officer if they meet certain requirements. The Chief Financial Officer transfers surplus funds to the Treasury for deficit reduction or debt reduction if no deficit exists. The Inspector General or designated agency employee and Chief Financial Officer issue standards for identifying surplus funds. The agency head can retain up to 10% of funds for cash awards to employees who identified surplus funds. Any remaining funds can be transferred or reprogrammed for agency use. The agency head must submit reports to the Secretary of the Treasury annually, detailing savings from fraud disclosures and surplus funds identified by employees. The agency head must submit reports annually to the Secretary of the Treasury on Federal cost savings and awards. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management ensures agency cash award programs comply with the requirements. The agency head must submit annual reports to the Secretary of the Treasury on Federal cost savings and awards. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management ensures agency cash award programs comply with the requirements. Every 3 years, the Comptroller General of the United States submits a report to Congress on the operation of the cost savings and awards program, with any recommendations for legislative changes. Section 4511 of title 5, United States Code, will be amended after 6 years from the enactment of this Act, changing the heading to "Definition" and modifying subsection (a) by redefining the term "agency." Section 4512 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by removing paragraph (2), subsections (c) through (g), and certain phrases related to surplus salaries and expenses funds. The table of sections for subchapter II of chapter 45 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by updating the item relating to section 4511. Section 4509 of title 5, United States Code, prohibits cash awards to certain officers, including those at level I of the Executive Schedule, agency heads, and members of independent establishments. The item relating to section 4509 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting new information. Prohibition of cash award to certain officers.
